title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [insert project's main purpose, e.g., streamlining task management, providing a customizable UI component library, etc.]. This repository showcases [mention key features or goals, e.g., a modern, efficient workflow, reusable and responsive UI elements, etc.] and serves as a demonstration of best practices in [mention relevant areas, e.g., front-end development, modular architecture, etc.].

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern, responsive dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It demonstrates best practices for building dynamic user interfaces with server-side rendering and client-side interactivity, providing a solid foundation for creating data-rich web applications and learning modern web development techniques.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface built with JavaScript, Python (likely for backend or data processing), HTML, and CSS. This project focuses on creating a dynamic and informative dashboard, potentially for visualizing data related to Robofleet or similar robotic systems. The dashboard allows users to monitor and interact with key metrics, providing a centralized view for managing and analyzing project-related information.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: crud-expense-tracker is a simple and intuitive web application built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML for managing and tracking personal expenses. It provides a full CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) interface for adding, viewing, editing, and removing expense entries. The project utilizes Material-UI for a clean and responsive user interface, offering a practical solution for budget management and expense analysis.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed as a dynamic and collaborative platform for brainstorming and organizing ideas. This interactive idea board allows users to easily create, categorize, and prioritize concepts, making it ideal for project planning, team collaboration, and personal organization. The repository demonstrates best practices in front-end development and aims to provide a user-friendly interface for effective idea management.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a personal project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and styled with CSS and Material UI (MUI). It serves as a dashboard and playground for experimenting with various technologies like React Query for data fetching and implementing best practices for a modern web application. The project showcases practical use of these technologies while offering a customizable development environment.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to input their sleep schedule and desired sleep duration, calculating their accumulated sleep debt over time. Focused on practical application and leveraging modern web technologies, this repository serves as a learning experience and a tool for improving sleep habits, with a strong emphasis on TypeScript best practices.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a CRUD application built with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL, showcasing a complete project implementation. Utilizing HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for various components, this repository provides a practical example for understanding web application development, database interactions, and server-side logic, making it a valuable resource for learning Flask-based projects.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This repository hosts a project focused on map visualization, leveraging HTML for the front-end interface and Python for data processing and potentially generating map tiles or handling backend logic. It aims to present geographical data in an interactive and insightful manner, exploring various methods to represent and analyze spatial information visually.

title: resume
description: This repository hosts the source code for my resume, built using TeX for generating a clean and professional PDF document. It also includes an HTML version for online viewing and accessibility. This project showcases my skills and experience in a clear and concise format, serving as a portfolio piece demonstrating proficiency in document preparation and web design.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack, real-time voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, JavaScript, and CSS. This project leverages modern web technologies to provide a user-friendly and efficient platform for creating and participating in polls, showcasing a practical implementation of front-end and back-end integration for real-time data handling and user interaction. It's a demonstration of a complete web application project centered around the topic of voting.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebook and Python, provides a practical project exploring financial analysis and modeling.  It serves as a hands-on resource for learning how to leverage Python's capabilities for financial calculations, data visualization, and potentially strategy backtesting, offering a practical approach to finance using code.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase, designed to provide a real-time asset tracking solution. This repository showcases a practical implementation of IoT principles using modern web development technologies, focusing on efficient data management and a user-friendly interface for monitoring asset locations and status.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project implementing a fully interactive and customizable event calendar using HTML and CSS for its structure and styling. This project allows for dynamic event creation, display, and management, providing a user-friendly interface for organizing and viewing events. It showcases practical application of JavaScript for front-end development and is a great example of a dynamic web application.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, leveraging Vite.js, Express.js, and the Gemini API to provide an interactive and engaging platform. This project showcases the integration of modern web technologies to create a dynamic user experience, demonstrating expertise in frontend development with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and backend development with Node.js and RESTful APIs.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. This project provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS logs, enabling developers to easily identify and debug issues within their robotic systems. The repository focuses on streamlining the log analysis process in ROS development.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a dynamic web project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focused on [mention the project's main purpose or functionality, e.g., exploring global news and events, creating a personalized travel guide, visualizing global data]. Leveraging modern web development practices, this repository showcases [mention key features or aspects of the project, e.g., interactive UI elements, API integrations, data visualizations]. Explore the code to learn more about building interactive web applications using these technologies.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a comprehensive e-commerce platform built with Next.js 14 (utilizing the pages router), TypeScript, and JavaScript, leveraging MUI for a rich user interface and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of a type-safe online store experience, showcasing key principles of modern web development and offering a robust foundation for similar e-commerce applications. It explores topics such as front-end architecture, UI/UX design, and data management within a Next.js environment.
